column1: Profession Family → BLS SOC Code mapping | Mapping Quality: High=near 1:1 alignment, Medium=partial, Low=fragmented/undercounted

NOTE: Low-quality mappings indicate where BLS occupational classification systematically undercounts environmental workforce. These are gaps in the labor market data infrastructure, not gaps in the taxonomy.

column7: Strong — SAF accreditation aligns with SOC definitions
Strong — primary SOC captures most roles
Partial — restoration spans multiple SOC codes
Strong for science side; engineering roles captured by 17-2081
Multiple SOC codes needed for full coverage
Partial — climate adaptation roles span many SOC codes
Low — no dedicated environmental informatics SOC code; BLS undercounts
Fragmented — policy roles appear across many management and legal SOC codes
Partial — NRCS/extension roles split across codes
Weak — no dedicated environmental educator SOC
Partial — wildland fire has no dedicated SOC; undercounted
Fragmented — EJ roles span health, planning, policy codes
Emerging — BLS lacks dedicated ESG/sustainability SOC
Fragmented — novel profession not well-captured by BLS
